metadata: (info { (description "Alkarhat is an alignment game played by Tuareg people of the Sahara. It is used for divination, with a holy man presiding over the game.") (rules "6x6 board. Thirteen pieces per player. Players attempt to surround another player's piece.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "1201") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/space/line/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Niger, around 1922.") } ) (graphics { (board Colour Phase0 (colour 223 178 110)) (board Colour InnerEdges (colour Black)) (board Colour OuterEdges (colour Black)) }) (recon { (concept "NumStartComponents" 26) })
